formattedAddress: storefront, 2317 1st Ave., New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: storefront, 2317 1st Ave., New York, NY 10035, USA

editorialSummary.text: Petite bakery cafe offering coffee, pastries & desserts, plus refined savoury & sweet dishes.

originalText.text: Visited on a Friday after having dinner a couple blocks away on a whim. Me and my partner bought the triple chocolate brownie, devil dog pudgie, and smores pudgie. Over all SOOO GOOD!!! Service was really friendly and atmosphere was homey. I recommend this if you‚Äôre near East Harlem.

text.text: Visited on a Friday after having dinner a couple blocks away on a whim. Me and my partner bought the triple chocolate brownie, devil dog pudgie, and smores pudgie. Over all SOOO GOOD!!! Service was really friendly and atmosphere was homey. I recommend this if you‚Äôre near East Harlem.

originalText.text: Lemon pepper wings and the pudgies are incredible! The Mac and cheese never misses in my experience. I‚Äôve ordered a lot online and have been here in person plenty of times and it‚Äôs been a go to for me anytime I‚Äôm visiting in Harlem I have to grab something from Evelyn‚Äôs Kitchen. It‚Äôs probably my favorite food spot on the east side. Definitely worth checking out.

text.text: Lemon pepper wings and the pudgies are incredible! The Mac and cheese never misses in my experience. I‚Äôve ordered a lot online and have been here in person plenty of times and it‚Äôs been a go to for me anytime I‚Äôm visiting in Harlem I have to grab something from Evelyn‚Äôs Kitchen. It‚Äôs probably my favorite food spot on the east side. Definitely worth checking out.

originalText.text: Hosted a private birthday party for my partner last minute (under a week), and Evelyn's Kitchen went above and beyond to help come up with a menu, accommodate my budget, all within less than a week's time, and was flexible to adjust for a fluctuating # of guests all throughout the week! They helped come set up and lay out the food, were timely and punctual and communicative, and all my guests loved the food and kept asking where we got catering! Would highly recommend for anyone throwing an event, large or small!

text.text: Hosted a private birthday party for my partner last minute (under a week), and Evelyn's Kitchen went above and beyond to help come up with a menu, accommodate my budget, all within less than a week's time, and was flexible to adjust for a fluctuating # of guests all throughout the week! They helped come set up and lay out the food, were timely and punctual and communicative, and all my guests loved the food and kept asking where we got catering! Would highly recommend for anyone throwing an event, large or small!

originalText.text:
VISITED JULY 7th 2023 To the staff, bakers, Maddy especially, everyone. I'd like to seriously thank everyone for making this dream come true. To be super honest my lil one honestly wasn't able to taste it (due to a series of unfortunate events and a lot of build ups the day ended bad).... But I'm not going to dwell on that. What I'm here to do is right a review...that's what I do!

Seriously from the first day I was stressing about finding a "school approved" super extra duper vegan cupcakes. Since I was planning my daughter's school approved daycare lil tiny party since her actual bday is tomorrow. I never realized how hard it is to seriously search for vegan bakeries ESPECIALLY IN THE CITY. It's like when I'm not looking for anything vegan I actually SEE IT but as an option! When I am looking it's like finding a needle in a haystack! It's actually difficult finding anything vegan! But after dealing with Erin's team..seriously I was THAT customer calling and asking questions...Maddy and her staff made everything just smooth while ordering through the PHONE! I didn't even visit to place an order! I literally spoke as if we were buddies talking! The process was easy! Yet I asked a lot!...

The ambiance is very tiny and small styled cafe ish establishment. Since you're only meant to place and order and go. So I didn't stay too long.

The presentation of my cupcake... my daughter's cupcake was and is beautiful! I ordered the vanilla pink frosting cupcake. It was just amazing....

I am depressed. To be honest. I'm on my way home and I honestly felt like I wasted this establishment time because I ordered this one special cupcake for my daughter. I got extremely excited especially when I was given tips on how to preserve it from getting spoiled ... thanks to the cashiers. I literally went across the street and grabbed several ice cups and made a cocoon surrounding this masterpiece... I went through a lot... for nothing because this bakery customer service overall is PERFECT. I'm deeply upset I couldn't present this to my daughter due to unfortunate stressful event..

Thank you everyone and

Please support this fine vegan establishment this local mast

originalText.text: Once upon a time, YEARS ago, I DM‚Äôd Ayala and told her that ‚ÄúI live in Texas but I tell ANY and EVERYone to go there if they mention they live in NYC or plan to visit. Twice my friends went to get me the Banana Pudding Pudgie whilst visiting there but both times the cafe was closed. ONE day I will get a pudgie!‚Äù I mentioned that I was temporary unemployed and couldn‚Äôt afford the shipping cost. Just like the kind heart that she is, she asked for my address and sent me a box of pudgies of every flavor that they made and luckily it was a holiday season, and I even got to taste the Pumpkin Spice Pudgies. Since then, any time any of my friends go to New York, I have them pick up a batch of pudgies for me as a ‚Äúsouvenir‚Äù üòÑ. I‚Äôm still obsessed with the Banana Pudding Pudgies and will only plan my next trip to NY around whether Evelyn‚Äôs kitchen will be open.
